subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... Interesting. What sound was Shakespeare writing when he wrote /E:/, etc? Paul
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:

>
> QS would be inadequate for the purpose: for example, it does not have
> a letter for the /E:/ used in Shakespeare's day for "meat", as distinct
> from /E/ ("met"), /e/ ("mate"), and /i/ ("meet").
>

Interesting. What sound was Shakespeare writing when he wrote /E:/, etc?

Paul
